text:
Came for the complementary breakfast buffet and welcome drink at lunchtime.
Breakfast buffet: Good selections of beverages. Limited choices of Western style, Chinese, Indian, and Japanese food. Crispy Hash brown. Fresh fruits (I like papaya). Not bad for simple breakfast.
Welcome drinks: different from the beverages station of breakfast buffet. For takeaways or dine in.
Very busy at the breakfast buffet. So quiet during lunchtime in spite of lunch special promotion.
Service: efficient, prompt. Smiles. Friendly and polite staff. Refill food and clean up very fast. So far, the best service among IBIS hotel's restaurants (compare with Singapore, Japan, and Australia). --- 8/10
Venue: typical decor. Slightly packed. Clean and tidy. Ourdoors dining is available. TV new during breakfast.

Decent lunch, ordered creamy seafood pasta, Hawaiian pizza, burger, Cajun chicken. All dishes were ok. Special mention to Ira and Nicholas who were friendly and attentive. Hope they will always enjoy their work :)
The lunch special was decent. The dish I had was Pork ribs & wedges.Went there after lunch hour and the food was to my liking. Overall, very good indeed.

Their food is value for money, especially their lunch set. Had the oglio alio spaghetti. The pasta was nicely done al dente, It has a light coating of olive oil with a tinge of spicy heat and succulent prawns üëç  The atmosphere is cosy and the service is great too. The service staff is very attentive and prompt.

If you are looking for a nice place to have a quiet and cosy meal, do drop by their cafe üëç

Tried this restaurant under eatigo 50% discount n it's good. Visited again for the SGD10 set lunch this time. The choices for set lunch is a little limited. There were only 3 prawns in my pasta but the taste is not bad tho. Set lunch comes w a drink. The coffee can do better. Tea seems a better choice w top up of hot water. Go for the eatigo deal. You will not regret it.
